function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Influenza virus transmission is more effective at lower temperatures, such as 5 C, compared to higher temperatures like 20 C or 30 C.","Impact":"Increased risk of airborne transmission of influenza virus in cool and temperate climates.","Mitigation":"Implement measures to enhance immune defense mechanisms and mucociliary clearance in cool environments.","Technologies":"Temperature control and environmental engineering to optimize indoor conditions.","People":"Individuals in cool and temperate climates.","Owner":"Health organizations and environmental engineers."},{"Description":"Enveloped viruses may have different survival patterns at different temperatures compared to non-enveloped viruses.","Impact":"Uncertain effectiveness of cleaning methods and surface disinfection for different types of viruses.","Mitigation":"Research and development of cleaning methods tailored to specific virus structures and environmental conditions.","Technologies":"Advanced disinfection technologies and virology research.","People":"Scientists, cleaning industry professionals, and public health organizations.","Owner":"Research institutions and government agencies."},{"Description":"Public health interventions may not be sufficient to stop disease outbreaks in modern society, according to mathematical models.","Impact":"Risk of ineffective disease control and prevalence in society.","Mitigation":"Application of engineering techniques combined with public health interventions for more effective disease control.","Technologies":"Advanced engineering methods for disease control and public health interventions.","People":"General public and healthcare professionals.","Owner":"Engineering and public health organizations."}]}
